subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Arturo Gatti, a two-time world champion, said he was retiring Saturday after being stopped in the seventh round by Alfonso Gómez in a 147-pound bout.A stunned crowd of more than 9,000 in Atlantic City — where Gatti, 35, is almost as revered as the New Jersey icons Bruce Springsteen and Jon Bon Jovi — looked on as Gómez punished Gatti, his former idol. Gatti, who grew up in Canada and moved to Jersey City in 1991, has a career record of 40-9.
